pr_title: Use BlockBasedRamAccounting for nested loop & hash join

timeline.bodyText: Not sure why there was a special exception for blockNestedLoop. To me it seems like there is also a single thread that uses the ramAccounting instance.
timeline.author: mfussenegger
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -883,7 +883,7 @@ public Boolean visitNestedLoopPhase(NestedLoopPhase phase, Context context) {
                 joinCondition,
                 phase.joinType(),
                 breaker(),
-                phase.blockNestedLoop ? ramAccounting : ramAccountingOfOperation,

replies.bodyText: Maybe it was just a mistake by me? I agree that only 1 thread will use it concurrently.
replies.author: seut

Use BlockBasedRamAccounting for nested loop

Using `ConcurrentRamAccounting` per row is expensive:

    # Results (server side duration in ms)
